question: Alright, first — what should I call you? Give me your first name, nickname, alter ego… whatever fits.
Got it. What energy am I speaking to here?
Cool. How old are you? I don’t judge — I optimize.
Height check — give it to me in cm or feet/inches. I’ll use this to call you tall, short, or aggressively average later on.
And what’s your current weight? Don’t hold back — this isn’t the DMV.
Alright, now that I know your stats, give me a second. Let me run a quick vibe scan and tell you what your name, age, and energy are screaming at me.
When you eat a bit more than usual — even just 200-300 calories — what usually happens?
options: Sometimes I gain, sometimes I don’t.
I stay exactly the same, no matter what.

question: Let’s flip it. When you try to lose weight, what’s the story?
options: I have to work *really* hard to see any loss.
I drop weight fast when I actually try.

question: Do this: wrap your dominant hand around your other wrist. What do you see?
options: Fingers don’t touch — I’ve got a big frame.

question: What do carbs (bread, pasta, sugar) do to your body and brain?
options: They knock me out — total energy crash.
They fill me up and I feel okay.
I feel more energized when I eat carbs.

question: After a typical meal (balanced or not), how do you feel?
options: It depends a lot on what I eat.

question: When you gain fat, where does it show up *first*?
If you actually commit to strength training — how fast do you see muscle?
options: It’s extremely slow or barely there.
I gain muscle fast — almost too easily.
No idea. I haven’t done consistent training.

question: Real talk: can you touch your toes without bending your knees?
options: Yes, but I have to try.
